main.name: Arslan Gait
main.description: I am trying to seize every opportunity I face, while being a lifelong learner and researcher
main.bio: I love coding and experimenting with the new technologies. A Java programmer, now I'm also interested in other backend programming languages and frameworks such as Python Django and Golang.
main.contactmessage: I most of the time use Telegram for quick messaging. Feel free to contact me there :)

education.degree: B.Sc. in Computer Science, Cum Laude, GPA: 3.67/4.00
education.description: A 4 year program taught me to be a thinker. Being a good student, I also engaged in social activities including volunteering at ACM Student Chapter and participation in local ACM ICPC Quarterfinal.

education.degree: General program + intensive Math and Physics, GPA: 5.00/5.00
education.description: Intensive studying of Math and Physics helped me to participate in various school olympiads, some of which were successfull.

work.title: Backend Developer
work.description: Working on internal banking system (bus). Java.

work.title: Full-Stack Engineer
work.description: Worked on a web application helping onboarding of new clients. Kotlin, Angular, Spring Framework, Hibernate, Kafka, Redis, PostgreSQL, nginx, Docker.

work.title: Full-Stack Engineer
work.description: Implementing a web application helping employees in judicial system. JavaEE, AngularJS, Hibernate, PostgreSQL, nginx.

work.title: Research Assistant
work.description: Conducted research in EEG Hyperscanning utilizing machine learning and Signal Processing. Research paper published in IEEE.

work.title: Research Intern
work.description: Conducted research and worked on development of the first Natural Language Toolkit for Kazakh

publications.company: Inter-subject correlations during natural viewing: A filter-bank approach*
publications.title: IEEE
publications.description: A. Gait, V. Duisenbinov, M. Lee, F. Bießmann and S. Fazli, “Inter-subject correlations during natural viewing: A filter-bank approach*”, 2020 42nd Annual International Conference of the IEEE Engineering in Medicine & Biology Society (EMBC), Montreal, QC, Canada, 2020, pp. 200-203

social.title: IEEE
social.description: IEEE EMBC 2020 Virtual Conference in Montreal, Canada.

social.title: ACM Student Chapter at Nazarbayev University
social.description: Mentored a group of 5 students during their programming courses. Helped with Data Structures in C and Java.

testimonials.text: Arslan has the ability to learn new things very quickly and his analytical skills will play a key role on his way of becoming an expert in the field of Computer Science.
testimonials.user: Siamac Fazli, PhD, Associate professor at School of Engineering and Digital Sciences, Nazarbayev University

testimonials.text: Arslan has a good analytical thinking and capacity. He can work alone and in team, and complete assigned tasks in time.
testimonials.user: Sain Saginbekov, PhD, Assistant professor at School of Engineering and Digital Sciences, Nazarbayev University
